title: Canada Reaches for Its Economic Past to Find a Future Less Reliant on the U.S.
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney fast-tracked mines and other natural resource projects to the dismay of some Indigenous groups and many environmentalists.

title: What to Know About Canada’s New Budget
description: The government of Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled a program of big spending to spur Canada’s economy and reduce its dependence on the United States.

title: Spurned by Trump, Carney Begins Thawing Canada’s China Connection
description: The meeting between Prime Minister Mark Carney and Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, came after a long period of tension and estrangement.

title: Carney Says He Apologized to Trump Over Ad Reviving Reagan’s Tariff Criticism
description: The Canadian prime minister also said that he had asked the province of Ontario not to air the ad that later prompted the president to end trade talks.

title: Canada’s Other Superpower Problem
description: The leaders of Canada and China met for the first time in eight years to try to reset relations after years of acrimony.

title: Scolded by Trump, Canada’s Prime Minister Turns to Asia for Trade
description: Mark Carney is pitching Canada as a predictable and responsible alternative to the United States.

title: Carney Says He Will Meet With Xi in South Korea
description: The meeting between Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada and Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, scheduled for later this week, appeared to signal a pivot to Asia after decades of poor relations between his country and Beijing.

title: How Canada Is Dealing With Its Latest Tussle With President Trump
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is focusing on what the country can control, including looking for economic partnerships abroad, especially in Asia.

title: Trump Announces Tariff Increase on Canada Over Reagan Ad Spat
description: The ad, which will stop airing on Monday, used audio of a 1987 address by Ronald Reagan making a case against tariffs.

title: Canada-U.S. Tensions Stay on the Ball Field as Blue Jays Stun Dodgers
description: At Game 1 of the World Series in Toronto on Friday, overt politics were absent. Unity between the two nations was on display before the first pitch.

title: Facing Lost Trade With the U.S., Carney Heads to Asia
description: The prime minister will attend two meetings and visit three countries as part of his plan to wean Canada off its dependence on the U.S.

title: New Trump-Canada Spat Spotlights ‘Captain Canada,’ the Ontario Premier
description: Doug Ford has built a reputation for picking fights with President Trump and getting under his skin with publicity-grabbing moves as U.S. tariffs have harmed Ontario’s economy.

title: Trump Says He’s Cutting Off Trade Negotiations With Canada
description: The president said he was motivated by an ad, paid for by the province of Ontario, that featured Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs in a 1987 radio address.

title: In Nod to Trump, Automaker Stellantis Shifts Production From Canada to the U.S.
description: Canadian leaders blame the move by Stellantis to abandon production in Ontario on President Trump’s tariffs. Mr. Trump says he wants to increase production in the United States.

title: Carney and Trump: A Collision Avoided, Save for a Nasty Comment or Two
description: The Canadian prime minister came to Washington determined to take the heat out of the relationship. He mostly succeeded, at least for now.

title: Trump Predicts That ‘Canada Will Love Us Again’ in Meeting With Carney
description: President Trump on Tuesday hosted Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada, who has been seeking relief from U.S. tariffs.

title: Canada and the U.S. to Hold Trade and Security Talks
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada will travel to Washington next week to meet with President Trump to try to ease some of the tariffs imposed by the United States.

title: Canada and Mexico Turn to Trains and Ports to Skirt U.S. Tariff Wall
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney touched down in Mexico City to regain Mexico’s trust and strategize with President Claudia Sheinbaum.

title: Leaders of Canada and Mexico Talk Trade and Security Without U.S.
description: Looming over the discussions was the desire to preserve the countries’ free-trade agreement with the United States.

title: ‘Elbows Down’? Canada’s Leader Struggles to Find the Answer to Trump.
description: After a stunning election victory on an anti-Trump message, Prime Minister Mark Carney is adjusting to the realities of dealing with the United States. Critics call it capitulation.

title: Canada Announces Major Projects to Offset Bite of Trump’s Tariffs
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled big infrastructure plans. But they are likely to meet resistance from Indigenous and environmental groups.

title: Hoping to Jump-Start Talks, Canada to Drop Some Retaliatory Tariffs on U.S. Products
description: Canada’s leader said he would follow the United States in dropping tariffs against American goods covered by the existing free trade agreement.

title: Facing Trump’s Threats, Mexico and Canada Draw Closer. Will It Last?
description: Mexico and Canada have long viewed each other with indifference or even distrust. They’re now talking about teaming up.

title: A Pay Raise for Canada’s Military to Boost Recruitment and Retention
description: Canada’s top military commander, however, says other measures will also be needed to keep people enlisted.

title: With Canada No Longer Able to Rely on U.S., Carney Pushes New Markets
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney suggested he’s unlikely to add additional retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods, but he is trying to help affected companies develop new products and find new buyers.

title: What Do Trump’s Tariff Hikes Mean for Canada’s Trade-Dependent Economy?
description: After Canada failed to strike a trade deal with Washington, the president raised tariffs on some Canadian exports this week.

title: Trump Gives Mexico a Reprieve but Slams Canada With Higher Tariffs
description: The imbalance in President Trump’s treatment of America’s closest trading partners may come from his desire to make Canada the 51st state, some Canadians believe.

title: Canada to Recognize Palestinian State at the U.N. General Assembly
description: Canada joins France and Britain in taking similar steps, after months of increasing criticism of Israel by Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: Trump Trade Deals Threaten Canada’s Vital Auto Industry
description: Recent pacts with Britain, Europe and Japan mean that autos exported from those countries and regions face lower U.S. tariffs than Canadian vehicles do.

title: Unified on Trump and Tariffs, Canada’s Premiers Differ on Next Steps
description: A three-day meeting in response to President Trump’s looming tariff threat underscored differences between the leaders of Canada’s provinces and territories.

title: Canada Says It Won’t Accept a Trade Deal With the U.S. at ‘Any Cost’
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney, after a meeting with Canada’s political leaders, downplayed the chances of success in talks aimed at reaching a trade deal with President Trump.

title: Canada Moves to Block Chinese Steel Now Shut Out of the U.S.
description: Canada’s steel industry fears that Chinese steel facing steep tariffs in the United States will be sent north and overwhelm the Canadian market.

title: Canada’s Leader Says There’s Little Hope of Avoiding U.S. Tariffs
description: After long insisting that Canada could avoid Trump tariffs through talks, Mark Carney now says that is unlikely for any nation.

title: In Canada’s Northern Outposts, Rusting Relics Once Guarded Against Nuclear War
description: Strings of radars stretching across Canada were built to give early warnings of Soviet bombers coming over the Arctic. The region now faces a new era of militarization.

title: ‘He’s Nuts, Your Trump.’ Canada Unites Against America.
description: America’s growing discord with Canada exemplifies the extraordinary damage President Trump is wreaking on the United States’ standing in the world.

title: Good Vibes in Trump Trade Talks Haven’t Shielded Canada From Chaos
description: The country’s new prime minister, Mark Carney, has been called the “Trump whisperer,” and negotiations have been cordial and professional. But it’s been a wild ride.

title: Canada Thinks Its Trade Talks With Trump Are Unique. Does That Matter?
description: Tariff negotiations between the two top trading partners are on a different track from those the U.S. is pursuing with other nations. But Canada may not get a better outcome.

title: Looking Beyond the U.S. for Trade, Canada Begins Shipping Natural Gas to Asia
description: A tanker is headed to South Korea with a first shipment of liquefied natural gas from Canada, which hopes to reduce its export reliance on its neighbor.

title: Carney’s ‘Build, Baby, Build’ Faces Pushback From Indigenous Groups
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney wants to fast-track nation-building projects to remake Canada’s economy. Indigenous groups want a seat at the table.

title: Canada’s Tax U-turn Highlights Trump Tariff Tactics
description: After President Trump suspended trade talks with Canada over its controversial digital services tax, Ottawa scrapped it to get back to the negotiating table.

title: Can Canada Offset Trump’s Tariff War With More Domestic Trade?
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney will meet his pledge to eliminate the country’s internal trade barriers by July 1. But economists say it’s not a substitute for lost U.S. trade.

title: Canada’s Trump-Fueled Brain Gain
description: The University of Toronto has attracted several U.S. professors amid turmoil between American higher-education institutions and the Trump administration.

title: No-Go Zones for a Sandwich in a Divided Canadian City
description: A city that straddles two Canadian provinces became a crucible of the barriers that prevent trade across Canada and that Prime Minister Mark Carney wants to dismantle.

title: Canada and E.U. Pull Together as America Pushes Them Away
description: The European Union and Canada struck a defense agreement on Monday, a step toward closer military cooperation as relations with the United States have soured.

title: India and Canada Move to Mend Rift Over Sikh Activist’s Killing
description: The rapprochement comes months after each country had expelled the other’s senior diplomats.

title: Flattery or Discipline? The Difficult Task of Managing Trump.
description: Canada’s prime minister Mark Carney deployed both methods on the first day of the Group of 7 summit in Alberta to keep Mr. Trump focused and avoid drama.

title: After Decades of Atrophy, Canada Vows to Beef Up Its Military. Can It Deliver?
description: To help shift the country away from its dependence on the United States, Canada’s prime minister plans to spend billions to revitalize its military and meet a NATO spending goal.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Meeting With Global Leaders in Canada
description: President Trump left the G7 summit early and abruptly to deal with the conflict between Israel and Iran.

title: Group of 7 Mountain Summit Time
description: Canada is hosting the major global meeting with President Trump and other world leaders. Here’s what to expect.

title: Canada Commits Billions in Military Spending to Meet NATO Target
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney promised to hit the alliance’s 2 percent spending threshold this year, seven years ahead of a previous schedule.

title: King Charles Visits Canada in a Subtle Rebuke to Trump
description: The British monarch, who is Canada’s official head of state, is coming at a moment when President Trump has threatened the country’s sovereignty.

title: Senators Visit Canada, Seeking a Reset Amid Trump’s Provocations
description: Democrats and one Republican made the trip, seeking to stabilize the U.S.-Canada relationship after President Trump imposed tariffs on Canada and suggested it should become the 51st state.

title: America’s New Ambassador to Canada Tamps Down Annexation Talk
description: Despite his friendly tone, Pete Hoekstra offered no indication of when, or if, the United States will remove its tariffs against Canada.

title: Tariffs Drive Honda to Move S.U.V. Production From Canada to U.S.
description: President Trump’s trade war again tests Canada’s new government. Honda is also postponing  a major electric vehicle factory in Canada.

title: Does the United States ‘Need’ Canada?
description: President Trump seems to think not. The industries he constantly mentions when he pushes his case, including autos, energy and lumber, beg to differ.

title: Trump Surprises Canada With a New Message: We Love You
description: President Trump played nice when he came face-to-face with the new prime minister of Canada, the country he has spent months belittling.

title: Carney Tells Trump Canada ‘Is Not for Sale’ During White House Visit
description: The Canadian prime minister met with President Trump days after being elected on an anti-Trump platform as relations between the two allies are at a historic nadir.

title: A New Trend in Global Elections: The Anti-Trump Bump
description: In voting in Canada and Australia, right-wing parties that borrowed from the MAGA playbook were punished. Elsewhere, President Trump is having a more complex impact.

title: After Leading a Liberal Comeback, Carney Hits the Ground Running
description: The prime minister will begin broad economic and security talks with President Trump next week and has set a timetable for his new government.

title: The World Is Watching Canada
description: Canada’s greatest opportunity lies in its ability to reframe its place in the world beyond America.

title: Mark Carney Swept Canada, but There Will Be No Honeymoon
description: The Canadian prime minister achieved a stunning political upset, running on an anti-Trump platform and promising to revive the economy. Now, he needs to deliver.

title: Canada’s Liberals Narrowly Miss Out on Majority in Parliament
description: Final results from Monday’s crucial election showed Mark Carney’s party had secured 169 of 343 seats and would need help from other parties to pass laws.

title: Canada Rejects Statehood
description: The anger in Canada is evident in many other ways; Canadians have always felt close to but distinct from Americans. A hostile America was something they never imagined.

title: Mark Carney’s Liberals Win Canada’s Election. Here Are 4 Takeaways.
description: The former central banker successfully convinced voters that he was the right candidate to confront President Trump’s trade war and threats to annex the country.

title: Mark Carney Wins New Term as Canada’s Prime Minister on Anti-Trump Platform
description: The election was dominated by Mr. Trump and his relentless focus on Canada. Pierre Poilievre, the opposition leader, lost the seat he had held for 20 years.

title: How Trump, Trudeau and Tariffs Upended Canada’s Political Landscape
description: After nearly a decade in power, the Liberal Party seemed destined to be swept out on a wave of anti-incumbency sentiment. Then events took a surprising turn.

title: Canada Votes, With an Eye on Trump’s Trade Policies
description: The two leading candidates, Pierre Poilievre and Mark Carney, both plan to fight the U.S., its largest trading partner, over tariffs. But who would be more successful as relations grow icy?

title: Canada Votes
description: We explain what’s at stake in today’s election.

title: Canada Votes: What’s at Stake?
description: Many Canadians believe Monday’s election is the most important of their lifetime. It will determine who will take on a stagnant economy and deal with President Trump.

title: China Experience Was Once a Plus. In Canada’s Election, It’s a Liability.
description: Mark Carney, who is running to win a full term as prime minister, has years of experience dealing with Chinese businesses and leadership. It’s become fodder for his opponents.

title: Canada’s Extraordinary Yet Uneventful Election Draws to a Close
description: President Trump’s tariffs and annexation ambitions continue to loom over all other issues in a race without any moments of campaign drama.

title: Climate Change, Once a Big Issue, Fades From Canada’s Election
description: Even though Liberal candidate Mark Carney has a lengthy climate policy résumé, Trump’s threats have nearly drowned the issue out of the campaign.

title: Polls Tighten in Homestretch of Canada’s Election
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s Liberal Party still appears poised to win, pollsters say, even as its lead over the Conservative Party has shrunk.

title: Canada’s Anti-Trump Finds His Moment
description: Mark Carney, the new prime minister seeking a full term in Monday’s election, has built his campaign around President Trump’s threats to the country.

title: Why Greater Toronto Could Decide Who Wins Canada’s Election
description: The Conservatives had enjoyed a lead over Liberals in the region largely because of rising housing and food costs. But President Trump’s tariffs have shifted the equation.

title: Canada’s Million-Dollar Housing Crisis
description: Soaring housing costs, with many homes nearing $1 million, have sparked an exodus from cities like Vancouver, and Canadians want their next prime minister to do something about it.

title: Despite His Shaky French, Canada’s Prime Minister Is a Hit in Quebec
description: Voters are overlooking Mark Carney’s linguistic gaffes and lack of knowledge about the French-speaking province, viewing him as the most capable candidate to deal with President Trump.

title: Who Will Be Canada’s Next Prime Minister?
description: The April 28 election will come down to two candidates with starkly different personalities and experience: Mark Carney and Pierre Poilievre.

title: 5 Takeaways From Canada’s Election Debate
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney was repeatedly the target of his opponents. President Trump’s threats on Canada loomed over the debate.

title: Paper Ballots, Hand Counting, No Machines: This Is How Canada’s Election Works
description: Canada’s federal election is on Monday. Here are the details.

title: Canada Reschedules Political Debate That Conflicted With a Hockey Game
description: A big game, but still.

title: Trump Tariffs Muddle Campaigning for Canada’s Conservatives
description: Pierre Poilievre’s 25-point lead in the polls evaporated, and he struggled to switch voters’ focus to the economy, crime and other issues.

title: Outside His Political Base, a Canadian’s Trumpian Pitch Is a Harder Sell
description: Pierre Poilievre, the Conservative seeking to become prime minister, fires up the faithful in Alberta, including Trump supporters, with his anti-elitist, anti-woke message.

title: Tariffs May Make It Too Expensive to ‘Drill, Baby, Drill’
description: President Trump’s tariff polices have sent oil prices falling, which may push energy companies to reconsider their plans to drill.

title: Trump, Tariffs, a New Leader: Canada’s Liberals Enjoy Early Election Lift
description: The Liberal Party, which not long ago seemed destined to crash in federal elections under Justin Trudeau, is experiencing a reversal of fortune. Here’s what a close review of polls shows.

title: The Canadian Political Brawler Who Had a 25-Point Lead and a Problem: Trump
description: Just two months ago, Pierre Poilievre seemed destined to become Canada’s next prime minister. But his double-digit polling lead vanished with President Trump’s threat to annex Canada.

title: Trump and Tariffs Enter the Scene Only Days Into Canada’s Election Campaign
description: Without advance notice to Canada, the U.S. president put the auto industry into turmoil with a 25 percent tariff.

title: Trump Tones Down His Rhetoric About Canada After Call With Its Leader
description: The president and Canada’s new prime minister, Mark Carney, spoke for the first time on Friday and promised to begin negotiations on trade.

title: Canada’s Leader Calls Snap Federal Elections Amid Trump Threats
description: Mark Carney, who has only been prime minister for 10 days, has called for a general election to be held on April 28.

title: The Carney Doctrine on Trump: Demand Respect, Be Patient, Diversify
description: On the road with the prime minister, we learned more about his approach to President Trump.

title: ‘Most European Non-European Country’: Canada Turns to Allies as Trump Threatens
description: Days after becoming prime minister, Mark Carney visited Paris and London to highlight deep European friendships as his country fights back against President Trump’s tariffs and annexation talk.

title: Canada Has a New Prime Minister With a Very Hard First Assignment
description: Mark Carney, a central banker turned politician, steps into his role at a crucial moment as President Trump sets his sights on Canada’s sovereignty and keeps threatening more tariffs.

title: Where Trump Is Giving Liberals a Hand
description: Being known as an enemy of Trump has become great politics in Canada and Mexico

title: New Canadian Leader’s Balancing Act: Negotiate With and Fight Trump
description: Mark Carney will most likely be in power just a few weeks before a federal election is held. To win, he will try to convince Canadians he can take on, but also negotiate with, Trump.

title: Canada Will Have a New Prime Minister. Here’s What to Know.
description: Mark Carney, a former central banker, now heads the Liberal Party and will soon lead Canada, tasked with responding to President Trump’s threats.

title: Banker Mark Carney Wins Race to Lead Liberal Party, and Canada
description: The prominent central banker and investor was chosen in a crucial leadership race amid threats from President Trump. He is expected to quickly call a federal election.

title: The Liberals Choose a Leader in the Shadow of Trump’s Threats
description: Party members will cast their votes on Sunday in a campaign that has been overshadowed by the unsettling signals from Washington.

title: Will Canadians Warm Up to the Steely Banker Eyeing Trudeau’s Job?
description: Mark Carney has pitched himself as the fix-it man who can set Canada back on track. As he seeks to lead the Liberal Party, the country’s biggest challenge may be President Trump.

title: Banker, Investor, Prime Minister? Mark Carney Bids to Lead Canada.
description: The former governor of the Canadian and British central banks announced he was running to become head of the Liberal Party and prime minister.

title: Here Are Three Possible Contenders to Succeed Justin Trudeau
description: Whoever replaces Mr. Trudeau as the leader of Canada’s Liberal Party will become the prime minister. Not long after they’ll face a general election, and the daunting challenge of keeping the job.

title: Justin Trudeau Is Stepping Down: What Comes Next?
description: The Canadian prime minister will not leave office until the next leader of his party is chosen, which could take several months.
